member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.IValidatableInfo
member.summary: Represents an interface for validating a value.

The validation context.
A cancellation token to support cancellation of the validation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.IValidatableInfoResolver
member.summary: Provides an interface for resolving the validation information associated with a given or .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.IValidatableInfoResolver.TryGetValidatableTypeInfo(System.Type,Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.IValidatableInfo@)
member.summary: Gets validation information for the specified type.
member.param: The type to get validation information for.
The output parameter that will contain the validatable information if found.
member.returns: if the validatable type information was found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.IValidatableInfoResolver.TryGetValidatableParameterInfo(System.Reflection.ParameterInfo,Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.IValidatableInfo@)
member.summary: Gets validation information for the specified parameter.
member.param: The parameter to get validation information for.
The output parameter that will contain the validatable information if found.
member.returns: if the validatable parameter information was found; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.SkipValidationAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a property, parameter, or a type should not be validated. When applied to a property, validation is skipped for that property. When applied to a parameter, validation is skipped for that parameter. When applied to a type, validation is skipped for all properties and parameters of that type. This includes skipping validation of nested properties for complex types.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified type is an enumerable type.
member.param: The type to check.
member.returns: if the type is enumerable; otherwise, .

member.summary: Determines whether the specified type is a nullable type.
member.param: The type to check.
member.returns: if the type is nullable; otherwise, .

member.summary: Tries to get the from the specified array of validation attributes.
member.param: The array of to search.
The found if available, otherwise null.

member.summary: Gets all types that the specified type implements or inherits from.
member.param: The type to analyze.
member.returns: A collection containing all implemented interfaces and all base types of the given type.

member.summary: Gets the parameter type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidatableParameterInfo.GetValidationAttributes
member.summary: Gets the validation attributes for this parameter.
member.returns: An array of validation attributes to apply to this parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidatableParameterInfo.ValidateAsync(System.Object,Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidateContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.remarks: If the parameter is a collection, each item in the collection will be validated. If the parameter is not a collection but has a validatable type, the single value will be validated.

The members that can be validated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidateContext
member.summary: Represents the context for validating a validatable object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidateContext.ValidationContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the validation context used for validating objects that implement or have . This context provides access to service provider and other validation metadata.
member.remarks: This property should be set by the consumer of the interface to provide the necessary context for validation. The object should be initialized with the current object being validated, the display name, and the service provider to support the complete set of validation scenarios.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidateContext.CurrentValidationPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the prefix used to identify the current object being validated in a complex object graph. This is used to build property paths in validation error messages (e.g., "Customer.Address.Street").

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidateContext.ValidationOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the validation options that control validation behavior, including validation depth limits and resolver registration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidateContext.ValidationErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets the dictionary of validation errors collected during validation. Keys are property names or paths, and values are arrays of error messages. In the default implementation, this dictionary is initialized when the first error is added.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidateContext.CurrentDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the current depth in the validation hierarchy. This is used to prevent stack overflows from circular references.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidateContext.OnValidationError
member.summary: Optional event raised when a validation error is reported.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationErrorContext
member.summary: Represents the context of a validation error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationErrorContext.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the property or parameter that caused the validation error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationErrorContext.Path
member.summary: Gets the full path from the root object to the property or parameter that caused the validation error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationErrorContext.Errors
member.summary: Gets the list of error messages associated with the validation error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationErrorContext.Container
member.summary: Gets a reference to the container object of the validated property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationOptions
member.summary: Provides configuration options for the validation system.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationOptions.Resolvers
member.summary: Gets the list of resolvers that provide validation metadata for types and parameters. Resolvers are processed in order, with the first resolver providing a non-null result being used.
member.remarks: Source-generated resolvers are typically inserted at the beginning of this list to ensure they are checked before any runtime-based resolvers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationOptions.MaxDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth for validation of nested objects. This prevents stack overflows from circular references or extremely deep object graphs. Default value is 32.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationOptions.TryGetValidatableTypeInfo(System.Type,Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.IValidatableInfo@)
member.summary: Attempts to get validation information for the specified type.
member.param: The type to get validation information for.
When this method returns, contains the validation information for the specified type, if the type was found; otherwise, null.
member.returns: true if validation information was found for the specified type; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.ValidationOptions.TryGetValidatableParameterInfo(System.Reflection.ParameterInfo,Microsoft.Extensions.Validation.IValidatableInfo@)
member.summary: Attempts to get validation information for the specified parameter.
member.param: The parameter to get validation information for.
When this method returns, contains the validation information for the specified parameter, if validation information was found; otherwise, null.
member.returns: true if validation information was found for the specified parameter; otherwise, false.

An optional action to configure the .
